title: Use accumulation for change in temperature of tea

content.question: A cup of tea is cooling in a room that has a constant temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>°</mo> <mi>F</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>. If the initial temperature of the tea, at time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> minutes, is <math> <mrow> <mn>200</mn> <mo>°</mo> <mi>F</mi> </mrow> </math> and the temperature of the tea changes at the rate <math> <mrow> <mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>6.89</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>0.053</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> degrees Fahrenheit per minute, what is the temperature, to the nearest degree, of the tea after 4 minutes?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
